intro: Hedysarum spectabile, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking orange to red petals and is part of the Fabaceae family, known for its leguminous properties. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats and has a distinctive, slender stem with alternate leaves. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hedysarum spectabile is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
